entry.title: Typography first
entry.content:
When it comes to typography, I’m by no means an expert, but I do know what I like. All design elements being equal, I think typography is more equal. Typography can make or break a design, so I chose to start with typography and not make very many changes at all to the default Octopress template Allexicon uses.

Convenience is important to me. I’m very busy and I don’t have a lot of time to spend working on getting things right. I’d rather spend the time writing, or on one of my other projects that has nothing to do with my blog. Convenience is the reason I went with a cloud-based solution.

I also want my blog to look distinctive. Less often used fonts have the advantage in this respect; I don’t want to use the same fonts as everyone else. This is the primary reason I completely discounted Google Fonts and gave Adobe Typekit a miss.

Although I really like the “small is beautiful” nature of Hoefler & Frere-Jones’s cloud.typography platform and convenience and distinctiveness are important to me, the beautiful fonts (and great font features, e.g. swashes) really sold me on it.
